info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 8:41PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Slick Roads and Bitterly Cold Temperatures Tonight... Snow accumulations have generally been an inch or less along and north of a line from Perryville MO to Illinois Route 13 in southern Illinois to the Ohio River bordering southwest Indiana and northwest Kentucky tonight. Even so, roadways will be very slick through the rest of the night and into Monday morning given the bitterly cold temperatures in place. As a result, you are advised to slow down and use extra caution while traveling tonight and early Monday. Additionally, temperatures will remain in the single digits through the rest of the night, with morning lows from around zero to 5 degrees expected. This will result in wind chill values from zero to around 10 below. Dress warmly in layers and ensure you have an emergency supply kit in case your vehicle breaks down in the extremely cold weather.
